dmca.title: Illegal and pirated information being hosted on your servers. http://www.helbreathnem
dmca.body:
Hello,

This is the same information as I sent in for another such server, and that one was
disabled. (hbsecrets.be.eml)

I'm also yet to hear anything back in relation to the hbnemesis site. That's also
attempting to extort IEntertainment in to allowing their servers to remain up
(information has been included in previous emails) as well as accepting donations to
their own pockets and not a non-profit orgainsation. Yet, their servers still remain
hosted by ThePlanet. 

It's the same information being sent, the same result would be expected or an
outline of where the information failed to meet the criteria as the same guidelines
were followed. Each of the websites that I've sent you are infringing on the
copyright this has been outlined multiple times now and yet they remain online. 

A non-automated response would be appreciated. 

Sincerely,

Tamara Bryan
Helbreath USA
Game Master



----- Original Message ----- 
From: "DMCA" <dmca@theplanet.com>
To: <tbryan@ient.com>
Cc: <Theplanet@chillingeffects.org>
Sent: Friday, December 29, 2006 12:27 PM
Subject: FW: [EV1-C2272351P] Illegal and pirated information being hosted on your
servers. http://hbpro.no-ip.info/


To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.ev1servers.net/About/dmca.aspx

Legal Response Team

-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@ev1servers.net [mailto:abuse@ev1servers.net] 
Sent: Tuesday, December 26, 2006 5:13 PM
To: DMCA
Subject: [EV1-C2272351P] Illegal and pirated information being hosted on your
servers. http://hbpro.no-ip.info/

==== Forwarded Ticket ====
1. Illegal and pirated information being hosted on your servers.
http://hbpro.no-ip.info/ Added by system at Tuesday, Dec 26 2006 08:23 pm

Message-ID: <117301c7295d$c05a9e10$1c01a8c0@tam>
From: "Tamara Bryan, Helbreath USA" <tbryan@ient.com>
To: <abuse@theplanet.com>
Subject: Illegal and pirated information being hosted on your servers.
http://hbpro.no-ip.info/
Date: Wed, 27 Dec 2006 13:21:02 +1100
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; 
boundary="----=_NextPart_000_116D_01C729B9.DB53F6B0" 
X-Priority: 1
X-MSMail-Priority: High
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2900.3028
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.3028
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 27 Dec 2006 02:23:27.0714 (UTC) FILETIME=[FE382C20:01C7295D] 

 (multipart/mixed)
Multipart prefix (text/plain)
This is a multi-part message in MIME format. 
 
 (multipart/alternative)
MIME element (text/plain)
Hello, 
 
  
 
I am Tamara Bryan, Gamemaster of HelbreathUSA http://www.helbreathusa.com .  I am
contacting you in regards to the web site http://hbpro.no-ip.info/ 
 
  
 
The official game site of the developer is located at http://www.helbreath.com and
legally licensed by http://www.helbreathusa.com.  This web site is hosting
information and files advertising and how to connect to their illegal server.  We,
iENT, are authorized by the copyright owner, Siementech, to seek out and close
illegal servers. 
 
  
 
Their actions include copyright infringement and software piracy related material. 
The source code for this game was illegally leaked to the public, and altered by
those not authorized by the copyright holder. 
 
  
 
The participants are violating the copyright agreement resulting in your servers
being used in an illegal fashion. Please take care of this abuse of our copyright
and your Terms of Service by removing the web site and any files relating to the
copyright. 
 
  
 
 
 
Given that the web site is not a "fan site" but a "illegal server site", we request
your assistance. Please advise me of exactly what action has been taken so that I
can advise the copyright owner and get that information back to you with what's
needed.   
 
  
 
Thank you for your prompt action in this matter. Given that I've had to report a few
servers to ThePlanet, I've taken the liberty of attaching the NDA and required
images. 
 
 
 
I also doubt that this will be the last server that I report. Is there another email
address that you'd rather I sent the emails to or is abuse@ fine? 
 
 
 
Happy New Year! 
 
  
 
Sincerely,  
 
  
 
Tamara Bryan 
 
Game Master Helbreath USA 

To Whom It May Concern:

 

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

 

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

 

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.

 

Legal Response Team

THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


________________________________

From: Tamara Bryan, Helbreath USA [mailto:tbryan@ient.com] 
Sent: Saturday, December 09, 2006 7:41 PM
To: Legal Response
Subject: Illegal and pirated information being hosted on your servers.
http://www.helbreathnemesis.com/
Importance: High


Hello,

 

I am Tamara Bryan, Gamemaster of HelbreathUSA
http://www.helbreathusa.com .  I am contacting you in regards to the web
site http://www.helbreathnemesis.com/

 

The official game site of the developer is located at 
http://www.helbreath.com <http://www.helbreath.com/>  and legally
licensed by http://www.helbreathusa.com <http://www.helbreathusa.com/> .
This web site is hosting information and files advertising and how to
connect to their illegal server.  We, iENT, are authorized by the
copyright owner, Siementech, to seek out and close illegal servers.

 

Their actions include copyright infringement and software piracy related
material.  The source code for this game was illegally leaked to the
public, and altered by those not authorized by the copyright holder.

 

The participants are violating the copyright agreement as your servers
are being used in an illegal fashion. Please take care of this abuse of
our copyright and your Terms of Service by removing this website.

 

The user has blocked my IP from being able to view the web site, given
that they know that I'm writing to the company that hosts the site.
They've also stated that IEntertainment should stop emailing their
service providers "or else" they'll release the source code publicly.
I've had to go to a different location in order to view the site, and
have others provide me with information from it. Please advise me of
exactly what action has been taken so that I can advise the copyright
owner and get that information back to you with what's needed.  

 

Thank you for your prompt action in this matter.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Tamara Bryan

Game Master Helbreath USA
